posts._title: Gorô Miyazaki – Kokuriko-zaka kara AKA From Up on Poppy Hill (2011)
posts.title: Kokuriko-zaka kara
posts.excerpt: A group of Yokohama teens look to save their school’s clubhouse from the wrecking ball in preparations for the 1964 Tokyo Olympics.

posts.title: Cheatin’
posts.excerpt: In a fateful bumper car collision, Jake and Ella meet and become the most loving couple in the long history of romance. But when a scheming “other” woman drives a wedge of jealousy into their perfect courtship, insecurity and hatred spell out an untimely fate. With only the help of a disgraced magician and his …

posts._title: Jimmy T. Murakami – When the Wind Blows (1986)
posts.title: When the Wind Blows
posts.excerpt: A naive elderly British rural couple survive the initial onslaught of a nuclear war.

posts._title: Kiriô Urayama – Yumechiyo nikki AKA Yumechiyo’s Diary (1985)
posts.title: Yumechiyo nikki
posts.excerpt: Yumechiyo Nikki is the story of a woman who is suffering from leukemia, the result of exposure to the atomic blast when she was still unborn. In the last three years of her life, she returns home, a small hot spring resort in the San-in Region and runs a geisha house inherited from her mother.

posts._title: Kinuyo Tanaka – Onna bakari no yoru aka Girl of Dark (1961)
posts.title: Onna bakari no yoru
posts.excerpt: In the late 1950’s prostitution was banned in Japan and if a woman was found exercising this profession they were sent to a reformatory. This is a story of one of these brave women Kuniko who is released from the reformatory and tries to build a new life.

posts._title: Hayao Miyazaki – Rupan sansei: Kariosutoro no shiro AKA Lupin the Third: The Castle of Cagliostro (1979)
posts.title: Rupan sansei: Kariosutoro no shiro
posts.excerpt: A dashing thief, his gang of desperadoes and an intrepid policeman struggle to free a princess from an evil count’s clutches, and learn the hidden secret to a fabulous treasure that she holds part of a key to.
posts.titleEnglish: Lupin the Third: The Castle of Cagliostro

posts._title: Paolo Virzì – Ovosodo AKA Hardboiled Egg (1997)
posts.title: Ovosodo
posts.excerpt: Can someone be hopelessly naïve and a cynic? Can someone be chronically depressed and positive? Can a hopeful young man ignore all his advantages and concentrate on his life’s drawbacks? These sorts of contradictions define young Piero (nickname “Ovosodo” or “Hardboiled Egg”, also the slang term for the slum area he inhabits). His mother is …

posts._title: Maéva Ranaïvojaona & Georg Tiller – Zaho Zay (2020)
posts.title: Zaho Zay
posts.excerpt: A young woman works as a prison guard in a hopelessly overcrowded jail in central Madagascar. She passes the time daydreaming about her father, a murderer, who abandoned her as a child after killing his own brother. In her imagination, her father becomes a mythical killer, wandering the countryside and rolling enchanted dice to decide …

posts._title: Hayao Miyazaki – Gake no ue no Ponyo AKA Ponyo on the Cliff by the Sea (2008)
posts.title: Gake no ue no Ponyo
posts.excerpt: A five-year-old boy develops a relationship with Ponyo, a young goldfish princess who longs to become a human after falling in love with him.
posts.titleEnglish: Ponyo on the Cliff by the Sea

posts._title: Hayao Miyazaki – Hauru no ugoku shiro AKA Howl’s Moving Castle (2004)
posts.title: Hauru no ugoku shiro
posts.excerpt: When an unconfident young woman is cursed with an old body by a spiteful witch, her only chance of breaking the spell lies with a self-indulgent yet insecure young wizard and his companions in his legged, walking castle.
